subdivision_of_building: The whole of Ground Floor except side entrance to upper floors.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings / document title number(s): PL-01 REV A (O.S.MAP, BLOCK PLAN, GROUND FLOOR & ROOF PLAN); PL-02 (EXISTING PLANS); PL-03 (EXISTING ELEVATIONS AND SECTION); PL-04 REV E (PROPOSED PLANS); PL-05 REV D (PROPOSED ELEVATIONS AND SECTION); PL-06 REV B (PROPOSED MECHANICAL EXTRACT STUDY); PLANT NOISE IMPACT ASSESSMENT REF 90792/NIA REV 01 DATED 02 FEB 2024; ODOUR RISK ASSESSMENT DATED JUNE 2023; SOUND INSULATION ASSESSMENT REF 92021/SIA REV 02 DATED 27 FEB 2024; EMAIL FROM AMRE A. TO CASE OFFICER DATED 12/10/2023 OF CLEANING AND MAINTENANCE SCHEDULE; EMAIL FROM AMRE A. TO CASE OFFICER DATED 07/03/2024 OF ADDITIONAL NOISE FROM EXTRACT
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the host property and local area, in accordance with Policies D3, D4, Policies 7.4, 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and Ealing Local Plan 2022 (Reg 19).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D4 and D6 of The London Plan (2021), policies 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and policies 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Core Strategy (2012). | The recommendations of the Odour Risk Assessment (ODOUR RISK ASSESSMENT DATED JUNE 2023) and details of the cleaning and maintenance schedule (EMAIL FROM AMRE A. TO CASE OFFICER DATED 12/10/2023 OF CLEANING AND MAINTENANCE SCHEDULE) shall be implemented in full prior to first use of the odour abatement equipment and extract system and thereafter be permanently retained and complied with.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/surrounding premises is not adversely affected by smell or steam, in accordance with Policies, 1.1 and 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The rating level (LAr,Tr) of the individual and combined maximum noise emitted by fixed plant, ducting and equipment on the site shall be lower than the existing background sound level by at least 10dBA, as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and at surrounding premises. The plant noise level at non-residential noise sensitive premises at the development site and nearby shall achieve the criteria of BS 8233:2014. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014 +A1 2019, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies D6, D13 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to use, machinery, plant and equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies D6, D13 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| The recommendations of the Sound Insulation Assessment (SOUND INSULATION ASSESSMENT REF 92021/SIA REV 02 DATED 27 FEB 2024) conclude that the development shall achieve an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 10dB/ 15dB/ 20dB, as necessary, above the Building Regulations value for residential use, of the floor/ ceiling/ walls separating the commercial premises from dwellings. The recommendations in assessment shall be implemented in full prior to occupation and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies D6, D13 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
description: Change of use from Sui Generis (pawnbrokers) to Class E(b) (restaurant). External alterations including extension to the front elevation, replacement shopfront, installation of kitchen extract on rear extension flat roof, erection of storage/coldroom in the backyard.
